text: Teldenia desma is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Wilkinson in 1967. It is found in New Guinea. The length of the forewings is 13-14.5 mm for males and 14–16 mm for females. The forewings are white, but the costa is buff. There is a double lunulate postmedial, a single lunulate subterminal and dotted terminal fasciae which are buff or brown and often very faint. The hindwings are as the forewings, but the costa is white., 1967: A taxonomic revision of the genus Teldenia Moore (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae, Drepaninae). The Transactions of the Zoological Society of London Volume 119, Issue 11 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1967 Category:Drepaninae
title: Teldenia desma
